page.title: 14I.B.A STATION _ USES
page.content: The television mast is situated in St Hilary near Cowbridge and was built in 1958.It was built to provide a black and white television service.The mast was set up by an Act of Parliament and was opened by the chairman of the Independent, Broadcasting,Authority who,at the time,was Sir Robert Fraser.The mast no longer transmits programmes as this was changed on the third of January 1985 . it now monitors the quality of programmes. A total of 40 people work at the mast,all live locally. The I.B.A.has 4 regional operation centres which have replaced the 14 earlier colour controls rooms from which the I.B.A.transmitter network is controlled.These are located at Croydon,Emleymoor,St Hilary and Black Hill.
